issues.description: The template's PersonResource.updatePerson handler does not accept the path variable personId (method signature: updatePerson(@RequestBody Person updatedPerson)), while the solution's handler requires the path variable and validates that the request-body id matches the path id (updatePerson(@RequestBody Person updatedPerson, @PathVariable("personId") Long personId) and checks updatedPerson.getId().equals(personId)). This is a structural mismatch in method parameters and expected behavior: students following the template may not perform or be guided to perform the id/path consistency check the solution enforces. It may also confuse students about the intended request contract for the PUT /persons/{personId} endpoint.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the template's updatePerson method signature match the intended contract used in the solution: add the @PathVariable("personId") Long personId parameter and validate that updatedPerson.getId().equals(personId), throwing a BAD_REQUEST ResponseStatusException if they differ. This makes the endpoint's request contract explicit and aligns template, solution, and expected behavior.
